aboutOverview.title: About Us
aboutOverview.para1: The development of the dairy sector in the region was formally initiated in 1989 with the establishment of the Raichur & Bellary Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd. during 1989–90. The Union was formed to strengthen organized milk production and marketing by bringing rural milk producers under a structured co-operative framework. From its inception, the Union aimed to create a sustainable system that would benefit farmers economically while ensuring a steady supply of quality milk to consumers.
aboutOverview.para2: The operational jurisdiction of the Union initially extended across the entire Raichur District, covering four talukas, and the Bellary District, comprising seven talukas. By organizing village-level milk producers into co-operative societies, the Union enabled farmers to collectively market their milk, access veterinary and technical services, and receive fair and timely payments. This approach significantly reduced exploitation by middlemen and improved income stability for rural households.
aboutOverview.para3: The Union adopted the AMUL co-operative model, which emphasizes farmer ownership, democratic management, and transparent operations. Dairying was promoted as a major subsidiary occupation, particularly for small and marginal farmers, with the objective of achieving socio-economic upliftment in rural areas. Through this model, the Union not only enhanced milk production and productivity but also contributed to employment generation and improved livelihoods.
aboutOverview.para4: Subsequently, the Union expanded its operational area by including Koppal District, leading to its reconstitution as the Raichur, Bellary & Koppal Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd. This expansion strengthened the regional dairy network and reinforced the Union’s role in rural development, making dairying a reliable and sustainable source of income for farmers across the three districts.

productsPreview.dairyProductsSubtitle: A wide range of fresh and high-quality milk and milk products delivered with care and trust.

overview.title: Overview
overview.text: This Privacy Policy describes the information collected by us (RBKVMUL – Raichur, Ballari, Koppala & Vijayanagara Milk Union Ltd.) through our mobile applications and related services and how we use that information.

children.title: Information of Children
children.text: Our services do not address anyone under the age of 13 as our services are not relevant to children. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13.

personalInfo.title: Personal Information
personalInfo.text: For a better experience while using our Service, we may require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including but not limited to location, name, address, mobile number, device model, and Android version.

location.title: Location
location.para1: This app collects location data to enable Check-in/Check-out functionality even when the app is closed or not in use. A notification is displayed to the user when location is being captured. Users are prompted before location capture starts.
location.para2: Once the user enables check-out, the location capture is stopped. We do not share the captured location with external sources.

advertising.title: Advertising
advertising.text: We do not allow third-party banner advertisements. We have no intention to introduce them, but if we ever do, this policy will be updated accordingly.

sharing.title: Sharing of Information
sharing.para1: We value your trust in providing your personal information and strive to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. We do not share personally identifiable information such as name, address, email, or phone number with other companies.
sharing.para2: However, please note that no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.
sharing.para3: Payment gateways and payment processing services are compliant with industry standards (PCI compliant service providers). Users are advised not to share full credit or debit card details through unencrypted platforms.
sharing.para4: Where a Customer ID and password are used to access the platform, users are responsible for keeping these credentials confidential and should not share them with anyone.

support.title: When You Request Support, You May Send Us Email
support.text: Users may contact us with questions about the use of our mobile applications. If a support request is submitted, we may receive the user's email address and other information provided in relation to the request.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.text: If you have any questions or concerns regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

changes.title: Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.text: This Privacy Policy may be updated from time to time. The use of information we collect is subject to the Privacy Policy in effect at the time such information is collected.

companyProfile.title: Company Profile
companyProfile.description: The development of the dairy sector was initiated in the year 1989. RBKVMUL (Raichur, Ballari, Koppala & Vijayanagara Milk Union Ltd.) was established during 1989–90, with its operational area extending across the entire Raichur District comprising four talukas and the Ballari District comprising seven talukas. The Union undertook the organization of milk co-operatives following the AMUL co-operative model, with the primary objective of achieving socio-economic upliftment of farmers in rural areas by promoting dairying as a major subsidiary occupation. Subsequently, the Union expanded its jurisdiction by including Koppala District, leading to its reconstitution as the Raichur, Ballari & Koppala Co-operative Milk Producers’ Societies Union Ltd.

mission.title: Our Mission
points: 1.To promote producer-oriented viable co-operative societies to impart impetus to rural income, dairy productivity, and rural employment.
2.To bridge the gap between the price of milk procurement and the sale price.
3.To develop business acumen in marketing and trading disciplines to serve consumers with quality milk and enhance the income of milk producers.
mission.note: Our Union is committed to the socio-economic development of its member milk producers by adopting advanced technology to make dairying a profitable business. Through dedicated workmanship, the Union aims to provide the best services to its members and consumers and achieve a leading position in Karnataka.

values.title: Our Values
list: Honesty
Discipline / Timeliness
Quality
Trust
Impartiality
Savings
Transparency

objectives.title: Objectives
objectives.description: Human Resource policies in the dairy industry cover core areas such as recruitment (skilled and unskilled), training (safety and technical), compensation, performance management, and statutory compliance. These policies place strong emphasis on workplace safety, prevention of harassment, leave management, and ethical conduct, along with specific regulations related to youth and child labour. Effective HR practices improve quality and productivity, reduce employee turnover, and enhance farm profitability by aligning people management with dairy operations and sustainability goals.

functions.title: Main Functions
list: Matching technical and physical skills with operational requirements and forecasting labour demand.
Establishing clear processes, communicating organizational culture and values, providing job descriptions, assigning trainers, and explaining workers’ compensation.
Ensuring mandatory safety training, accident and injury reporting, emergency preparedness, personal hygiene standards, and drug and alcohol policies.
Promoting professionalism, respect, anti-harassment practices, confidentiality, conflict-of-interest management, and attendance discipline.
Providing fair wages and benefits to attract and retain skilled personnel while ensuring employee satisfaction.
Encouraging feedback, skill enhancement, and linking performance outcomes to quality and productivity goals.
Defining clear policies related to holidays, sick leave, and other statutory leave provisions.
Implementing strict regulations on minimum working age, working hours, and mandatory fitness certification.
Aligning HR practices with environmental and sustainability goals to promote values-driven commitment.
Ensuring that skilled and motivated employees directly contribute to improved milk quality and quantity.
Reducing high employee turnover commonly associated with farm-related work through effective HR management.
Ensuring compliance with all legal requirements, particularly those related to safety and youth employment.
Achieving operational efficiency and financial success through effective workforce management.
functions.summary: Organizations should begin with essential policies related to safety, conduct, and leave, and gradually build comprehensive HR systems. Special focus should be given to integrating human resource practices with the unique operational requirements of dairy farming.

key.title: Our Key Objectives
list: Profit maximization from the dairy sector.
Socio-economic stability of dairy farmers across the state.
Compliance with the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006.
Ensuring the supply of fresh and safe milk to consumers.
Increasing rural employment opportunities through entrepreneurship.
Sustainable development of the dairy sector.
Strengthening organized dairy farming through co-operative institutions.
Value addition and improved marketing to ensure fair prices for farmers.
Innovation, research, and development for cost-effective production.
Providing adequate and quality services at the farmers’ doorstep.
Technology transfer through effective extension activities.
Automation of milk collection and pricing systems of dairy co-operatives.
Unification of accounting and management systems of dairy co-operatives.
Creating strong networks among dairy co-operatives, the Dairy Development Department, and other stakeholders for efficient management.
key.note: These objectives guide the Union’s operations and ensure continued service to farmer members and urban consumers while promoting rural development and sustainable dairy practices.

quality.title: Quality & Food Safety
list: Ensuring healthy animals, clean housing, balanced feeding, and responsible use of antimicrobials.
Strict hand hygiene, use of clean protective attire, and reporting of illnesses to prevent contamination.
Maintaining cleanable facilities with proper drainage and regular sanitation of equipment such as milking machines and storage tanks.
Immediate cooling of milk, testing for antibiotics and contaminants at collection points, and maintaining the cold chain during transport.
Implementation of HACCP, pasteurization, and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) to control biological, chemical, and physical hazards.
Regular laboratory testing for fat, protein, bacterial counts, somatic cells, residues, and adulterants.
Maintaining detailed records at all stages to enable traceability, accountability, and rapid product recalls.
Commitment to producing safe and superior quality milk and milk products.
Meeting or exceeding all statutory requirements and consumer expectations.
Continuous improvement in quality and food safety performance.
Ensuring transparent communication of quality and food safety policies to all stakeholders.

ballari.title: Ballari: The Spiritual Guardian
ballari.text: Ballari’s identity is deeply rooted in its spiritual heritage, centered around the revered Kanaka Durgamma Temple. As the presiding deity of the city, Durgamma is regarded as the protector of the region, and the temple stands as a powerful symbol of faith that unites the local community.

koppal.title: Koppal: The Kashi of the South
koppal.text: Koppal carries a profound legacy of peace and service, anchored by the magnificent Gavi Siddeshwara Matha. This ancient cave monastery is a cornerstone of the Lingayat tradition, renowned for its concept of “Trividha Dasoha” — the selfless service of providing free food, education, and spiritual shelter to all.

raichur.title: Raichur: The Land of Forts and Gold
raichur.text: Raichur is a region where historical strength meets industrial pride, most notably represented by the Hatti Gold Mines. As one of the oldest gold mines in the world, it reflects the district’s rich mineral heritage and its strategic importance between the Krishna and Tungabhadra rivers.

vijayanagara.title: Vijayanagara: The Eternal City
vijayanagara.text: The ruins of Vijayanagara at Hampi stand as a breathtaking testament to the pinnacle of South Indian Hindu architecture. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the region features the iconic Stone Chariot, the towering Virupaksha Temple, and intricate musical pillars that echo the grandeur of one of India’s most powerful historical empires.

activities.title: Activities
activities.procurementIntro: The procurement process involves collecting milk from producers, ensuring quality through rigorous testing (fat, SNF, adulteration), rapid chilling for freshness, and transportation to the dairy plant through village collection and chilling centers. Farmers are paid based on milk quality, ensuring transparency and consistent, high-quality supply.
activities.breakdown: Here's a breakdown of the key stages:

sourcing.title: Sourcing & Collection
points: Milk is delivered by farmers, often twice daily, to local collection centers managed by cooperatives or the dairy.
Dairies establish their own collection centers or appoint agents to collect milk from producers.
Farmers are trained in hygienic milking and handling practices to ensure clean milk.

testing.title: Quality Testing & Chilling
points: Milk is weighed and tested for fat, Solids-Not-Fat (SNF), and adulteration at village level centers.
Milk is rapidly cooled to preserve freshness and prevent bacterial growth.
Samples are taken for detailed laboratory analysis before dispatch.

transport.title: Transportation & Processing
transport.p1: Chilled milk is transported in insulated tankers to the main dairy plant, often via chilling centers.
transport.p2: Upon arrival, milk undergoes further quality checks before pasteurization and processing.

payment.title: Payment & Management
points: Farmers are paid based on milk quantity and quality, usually at regular intervals.
Payment slips include quality parameters and payable amounts, with funds transferred to bank accounts.

goals.title: Key Goals
points: Ensuring fair prices for milk producers.
Educating farmers on fodder enrichment, silage preparation, and azolla cultivation.
Maintaining high standards from farm to plant.
Building strong cold chains and organized collection routes.
goals.summary: This system relies heavily on technology and strong farmer relationships to ensure a reliable, high-quality milk supply chain.

animalHealth.title: Animal Health Services
animalHealth.intro: The animal health system is designed to ensure animal welfare, reduce operational costs, and maintain high-quality milk production.
animalHealth.coreP1: The system focuses on prevention through biosecurity, vaccination, nutrition, housing, and staff training.
animalHealth.coreP2: Early detection and prompt treatment help protect animal health and milk safety.
bioPoints: Limiting and screening new animal introductions.
Maintaining clean housing, equipment, and water supplies.
Providing balanced feed and stress-free housing.

ai.title: Artificial Insemination & Emergency Activities
ai.intro: Artificial Insemination (AI) is a scientific breeding method that improves genetic quality without natural mating.
ai.processDesc: The AI procedure includes heat detection, semen thawing, insemination, and uterine deposition to ensure conception.
semenPoints: Semen is collected from genetically superior bulls.
Semen is mixed with extenders for protection and nutrition.
Semen straws are frozen in liquid nitrogen at −196°C for long-term storage.

fodder.title: Fodder Activity
fodder.intro: Fodder production ensures balanced nutrition, improves milk yield, and supports sustainable dairy farming.
traditionalPoints: Assessment of herd size, land, water, and climate.
Land preparation, sowing, irrigation, and pest control.
Harvesting at optimal growth stages for nutrition.
conservationPoints: Fermenting green fodder in airtight silos as silage.
Sun-drying fodder to produce hay for storage.

step.title: STEP & Processing Activities
step.stepTitle: Support to Training and Employment Programme for Women (STEP)
step.stepDesc: STEP empowers women through training, employment, and financial inclusion in the dairy sector.
stepPoints: STEP: Financial and technical support for Women Dairy Cooperative Societies.
NPDD: Training on clean milk production, animal health, and nutrition.
NABARD: Support through Self Help Groups and concessional credit.
step.processingDesc: Dairy processing converts raw milk into safe products through systematic treatment and packaging.
coreSteps: Milk collection, testing, cooling, and storage.
productSteps: Milk powder production via evaporation and spray drying.

popup.title: Announcement
popup.subtitle: Mega Dairy Outline
popup.description: Upcoming Mega Dairy at Bellary Taluka Kolagal Grama. Approved by Karnataka Mining Environment Restoration Corporation (KMERC).

cancellation_returns.title: Cancellation & Returns
cancellation_returns.paragraph1: We, at RBKVMUL, are committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction. Due to our strict quality standards, products once opened cannot be repackaged or resold. Therefore, we do not accept returns on opened merchandise.
cancellation_returns.paragraph2: In unusual circumstances, if a product is damaged during delivery, we offer a replacement. Any product damage must be reported to the respective marketing representative within 24 hours of delivery. The product must be self‑shipped to our address for verification.
cancellation_returns.paragraph3: Upon receipt of the product, quality checks will be performed and a replacement or refund claim will be issued as per the requirement. Refund claims will be adjusted in the invoice.
cancellation_returns.paragraph4: Please note that exchanges or refunds are not offered on opened or used products. RBKVMUL is not responsible for damages occurring after delivery.

processing_time.title: Processing Time
processing_time.paragraph1: Please allow one to three working days from the date of return for your request to be processed. You will be contacted once the return process is complete.
processing_time.paragraph2: All claims for damages or missing items must be reported within 24 hours of delivery. Requests made after 24 hours will not be processed.

exclusions.title: Exclusions
exclusions.paragraph1: Damages caused due to negligence or incorrect application are not covered under the Returns Policy.
exclusions.paragraph2: No exchange or return will be processed in cases where there are no quality‑related issues.
exclusions.paragraph3: Consumers are advised to ensure lactose tolerance before consuming the products.

cancellation_policy.title: Cancellation Policy
cancellation_policy.paragraph1: Orders placed through https://www.rbkvmul.in can be cancelled before dispatch. Once the order has been dispatched or delivered, it cannot be cancelled and no refunds will be issued.

out_of_stock.title: Out of Stock Items
out_of_stock.paragraph1: In case of out‑of‑stock items, customers may add products to their wishlist. Once the products are back in stock, an automated notification will be sent, allowing the order to be placed easily.

payments.title: Payments
payments.paragraph1: RBKVMUL offers the following payment options:

list.net_banking: Net Banking (all major banks in India)

payments.paragraph2: All online payments are processed through trusted payment gateways using encryption technology to ensure secure transactions. Payments made via card or net banking are safe and secure.

USING THE SITE (WHICH INCLUDES ACCESSING AND BROWSING) INDICATES YOUR AGREEMENT TO ALL THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS IN THIS AGREEMENT, SO PLEASE READ THIS AGREEMENT CAREFULLY BEFORE PROCEEDING.

You agree that any Content you post may be used by RBKVMUL, consistent with our Privacy Policy and Rules of Conduct on Site as mentioned herein, and you are not entitled to any payment or other compensations for such use.

You may not post or submit or transmit Content, (even if made in a joking, sarcastic or unintended manner), if it in any way: is patently offensive to the online community, such as sexually explicit content, or content that promotes obscenity, paedophilia, racism, bigotry, hatred or physical harm of any kind against any group or individual; harasses or advocates harassment of another person; involves the transmission of "junk mail," "chain letters," or unsolicited mass mailing or "spamming"; promotes illegal activities or conduct that is abusive, threatening, obscene, defamatory or libellous.

conduct.paragraph5: You must use the Site in a manner consistent with any and all applicable laws and regulations. Illegal and/or unauthorized uses of the Site, including without limitation, collecting usernames and/or email addresses of registered members by electronic or other means for the purpose of sending unsolicited email and unauthorized framing of or linking to the Sites, are not permitted.
conduct.paragraph6: You may not engage in advertising to, or solicitation of, other users through the Sites to buy or sell any products or services, including, but not limited to, products or services related to the Sites.

Notwithstanding this right of RBKVMUL, YOU REMAIN SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CONTENT OF THE MATERIALS YOU POST IN THE PUBLIC AREAS OF THE SITES AND IN YOUR PRIVATE MESSAGES.
